title: Question 6
prompt: When Nora says, “If that were to happen, I don’t suppose I should care whether I owed money or not,” this statement shows that she
description: Click the <u>one best answer</u> to each question.
feedback: Torvald proposes a hypothetical situation to Nora. What if he borrowed a lot of money and then died before he could earn the money he is expecting to make next year? Nora reacts to the idea of Torvald being killed, not being left in debt. When faced with the idea of Torvald’s death, Nora is not concerned about money. Her statement implies that Nora cares more about Torvald than about money.
